summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between attorney Mariann Wang and others, including Gloria Allred, regarding scheduling interviews for clients who are potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a list of clients with initials and summaries of their alleged abuse timelines and locations.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP corresponding to schedule client interviews with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Epstein/Maxwell allegations.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney from Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, co-counsel with Mariann Wang, involved in communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office about victim interviews.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred who sent the Zoom meeting details for a scheduled call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator in the client allegations; his death is referenced in the document context.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a co-conspirator; specific clients report interactions with her.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in one client's allegation as having an interaction with her at Epstein's townhouse in 2010.

connections.description: Co-counsels working together to represent clients who are potential victims of Epstein and Maxwell.
Diane Aldrich is the Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred.
Both are named as perpetrators in the client allegations, with Maxwell allegedly recruiting and interacting with victims.
Prince Andrew is mentioned in the context of a client's final interaction with Epstein at his townhouse in 2010.

events.title: Scheduled client interviews
events.description: Mariann Wang checks availability to interview clients who had to be adjourned a few weeks prior.

events.title: Zoom call between attorneys and AUSA
events.description: A Zoom call was scheduled for 2 PM ET between attorneys Allred/Wang and an Assistant U.S. Attorney to discuss new potential victims prior to scheduling interviews.

events.title: Alleged abuse incident in New York
events.description: One client (AR) alleges one incident of abuse in New York in 2002.

events.title: Multiple alleged abuse incidents
events.description: Multiple clients allege incidents in New York, Florida, and other locations between 2003 and 2004, with some involving Maxwell and other men at Epstein's direction.

events.title: Client interaction with Prince Andrew
events.description: One client's final interaction with Epstein included an interaction with Prince Andrew at Epstein's townhouse.

keyFacts: Attorney Mariann Wang, in coordination with Gloria Allred, was scheduling interviews for multiple clients alleging abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in 2020.
The client list includes allegations spanning from 2000 to 2017, with incidents occurring in New York, Florida, Paris, California, and Washington, DC.
One specific allegation mentions a client's interaction with Prince Andrew at Epstein's New York townhouse in 2010.
The correspondence shows ongoing coordination between victim attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The document references a need for clarification about 'photograph info' before conveying it to clients, indicating potential evidence being reviewed.
